Package p

Package containing all classes of Fishing.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
Boat This is the boat with the net what we can move to catch fishes.
Stores a reference to the water surface for asking the drifting velocity and to determine the y coordinate of the boat (it depends (equals to) the water level at the position of the boat).
The boat is a MovingObject with some restrictions: The boat can move only horizontally, the water level determines its y coordinate.
Bubble Class representing a bubble in the water.
The bubbles are simply light circles.
Fish Class representing a fish.
Fishing Main class of Fishing.

This program has been created for the event of the Java technology turns 10!.

This is the controller layer of Fishing in the MVC architecture.
GameModel This is the game model.
GameScene The game scene.
This is the view layer of Fishing in the MVC arhitecture.
MovingObject Represents an object which is positioned in plane and can move in both x and y direction.
Position is determined by x and y coordiantes.
The coordinates and the components of velocity are in double precision.
The position is visible in int precision, in all cases it is enough, and where we use the position outside of the class needed as int too!
WaterSurface This class simulates the water surface which is basically a sin function.
The surface function is:
Amplitude*sin(phi+omega*x)
 

Enum Summary
GameScene.ControlKeys Enum constants for the control keys.
 

Package p Description

Package containing all classes of Fishing.
